title: Scientific Inquiry and Controlled Experiments

vocab.definition: A test where only one variable is changed at a time
The factor that is changed in an experiment
The factor that is measured in an experiment
The group in an experiment that doesn't receive the treatment
Examining and interpreting the results of an experiment

teachingNotes: Guide students through designing fair tests. Emphasize the importance of controlling variables and collecting reliable data. Practice identifying variables in different experimental scenarios.

sample.question: Why is it important to control variables in an experiment?

truefalse.question: In a controlled experiment, you should change as many variables as possible.

multiplechoice.question: In an experiment testing plant growth with different fertilizers, what is the independent variable?

fillintheblank.question: The group that doesn't receive the experimental treatment is called the ________ group.

shortanswer.question: What should you do after collecting data from an experiment?
